thread.title: Hundreds of alligators gather for Florida sunbathing session...
thread.title_full: Hundreds of alligators gather for Florida sunbathing session...

title: Hundreds of alligators gather for Florida sunbathing session...
text:
SUNNIN' ON CROC OF THE BAY Hundreds of alligators gather at Florida watering hole for sunbathing session 
The tightly packed group of alligators is so large the predators can even be seen on Google Earth satellite images By Olivia Loveridge-Greene 5th March 2017, 10:16 pm Updated: 6th March 2017, 2:08 am Comments TWO hundred alligators were snapped sunbathing at a Florida watering hole by Brit wildlife snapper Lee Dalton. 
Lee, 38, of Ardingly, West Sussex said of the scene at Myakka River State Park: “It was intimidating but incredible. I felt privileged.” Solent News A group of two hundred alligators were snapped at a Florida watering hole Solent News The predators gathered together for a sunbathing session Solent News 5 The sinkhole’s unique ecosystem makes for a great habitat for the alligator’s prey 
Predators including bald eagles and vultures often gather alongside the alligators as the sinkhole’s unique ecosystem makes for a great habitat for fish. 
The reptiles are often only seen individually or in small clusters of three or four. 
The large gathering at the US sinkhole is said to be so large Google Earth can even pick them up. MOST RECENT IN WORLD NEWS hell in mosul Weeping dad carries daughter through Mosul as Iraqi government rains rockets on city in fight to win it back from ISIS jihadis 'I'VE BEEN ARRESTED' Brit daredevil free runner who climbed Wembley Stadium quizzed by Dubai cops INSTANT CAR-MA Dramatic moment BMW driver tries to show off in his new motor but slams into the side of a cliff ROCKET ALERT North Korea 'fires FOUR unidentified projectile capable of hitting US mainland' NEW HORIZONS Tony Blair denies attending secret White House summit and being offered peace envoy job with Donald Trump HOW DID SHE SURVIVE? Heartstopping moment woman plunges eight floors from burning apartment block - and survives Solent News Wildlife photographer Lee Dalton caught snaps of large group of beasts Solent News 5 The group of reptiles is said to be so large they can even be seen on Google Earth 
The photographer said: “I kept my distance and put any thoughts of taking a cooling dip in the sink hole out of my mind. 
“On the whole, humans are too large to be considered suitable prey for your average alligator, however on very rare occasions there are fatalities in Florida. 
“It’s a pretty special sight, especially considering that, at one point in the 1960s, the American alligator was close to becoming extinct due to excessive hunting. 
“Thankfully protection has helped numbers bounce back.” Video of huge 'dinosaur' alligator in Lakeland, Florida sparks speculation
